Azure.Search.Name.Synopsis: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) has requirements for AI Search service names.
Azure.Search.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Azure AI Search service naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.AppService.NETVersion.Name: Azure.AppService.NETVersion
Azure.AppService.NETVersion.Synopsis: Configure applications to use newer .NET versions.
Azure.AppService.NETVersion.Recommendation: Consider updating the site to use a newer .NET version such as v8.0.

Azure.VM.AMA.Name: Azure.VM.AMA
Azure.VM.AMA.Synopsis: Use Azure Monitor Agent for collecting monitoring data from VMs.
Azure.VM.AMA.Recommendation: Consider monitoring virtual machines (VMs) with the Azure Monitor Agent.

Azure.EntraDS.NTLM.Name: Azure.EntraDS.NTLM
Azure.EntraDS.NTLM.DisplayName: Entra Domain Services allows insecure version of NTLM
Azure.EntraDS.NTLM.Synopsis: Disable NTLM v1 for Microsoft Entra Domain Services.
Azure.EntraDS.NTLM.Recommendation: Consider disabling NTLM v1 which is considered weak and can be disabled if not required.

Azure.Resource.AllowedRegions.Name: Azure.Resource.AllowedRegions
Azure.Resource.AllowedRegions.DisplayName: Resource deployment location is not allowed
Azure.Resource.AllowedRegions.Synopsis: The deployment location of a resource determines the country or region where metadata and data is stored and processed.
Azure.Resource.AllowedRegions.Recommendation: Consider deploying resources to allowed regions to align with your organizational requirements. Also consider using Azure Policy to enforce allowed regions at runtime.

Azure.PublicIP.Naming.Name: Azure.PublicIP.Naming
Azure.PublicIP.Naming.DisplayName: Public IP addresses must use standard naming
Azure.PublicIP.Naming.Synopsis: Public IP addresses without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.PublicIP.Naming.Recommendation: Consider creating public IPs with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.ACR.Firewall.Name: Azure.ACR.Firewall
Azure.ACR.Firewall.DisplayName: Container Registry service firewall is not restricted
Azure.ACR.Firewall.Synopsis: Container Registry without restrictions can be accessed from any network location including the Internet.
Azure.ACR.Firewall.Recommendation: Consider restricting network access to trusted clients to harden against unauthorized access or exfiltration attempts.

Azure.EventGrid.DisableLocalAuth.Name: Azure.EventGrid.DisableLocalAuth
Azure.EventGrid.DisableLocalAuth.DisplayName: Use identity-based authentication for Event Grid topics
Azure.EventGrid.DisableLocalAuth.Synopsis: Authenticate publishing clients with Azure AD identities.
Azure.EventGrid.DisableLocalAuth.Recommendation: Consider only using Azure AD identities to publish events to Event Grid. Then disable authentication based on access keys or SAS tokens.

Azure.VNET.FirewallSubnetNAT.Name: Azure.VNET.FirewallSubnetNAT
Azure.VNET.FirewallSubnetNAT.DisplayName: Use NAT gateway with Azure Firewall for outbound access
Azure.VNET.FirewallSubnetNAT.Synopsis: Zonal-deployed Azure Firewalls should consider using an Azure NAT Gateway for outbound access.
Azure.VNET.FirewallSubnetNAT.Recommendation: Consider using an Azure NAT gateway for zonal-deployed Azure Firewalls for outbound access.

Azure.VM.ShouldNotBeStopped.Name: Azure.VM.ShouldNotBeStopped
Azure.VM.ShouldNotBeStopped.DisplayName: VMs should not be stopped state
Azure.VM.ShouldNotBeStopped.Synopsis: Azure VMs should be running or in a deallocated state.
Azure.VM.ShouldNotBeStopped.Recommendation: Consider fully de-allocating VMs instead of stopping VMs to reduce cost.

Azure.AppGw.Prevention.Name: Azure.AppGw.Prevention
Azure.AppGw.Prevention.Synopsis: Internet exposed Application Gateways should use prevention mode to protect backend resources.
Azure.AppGw.Prevention.Recommendation: Consider switching Internet exposed Application Gateways to use prevention mode to protect backend resources.

Azure.ML.DisableLocalAuth.Name: Azure.ML.DisableLocalAuth
Azure.ML.DisableLocalAuth.DisplayName: Disable local authentication on ML Compute
Azure.ML.DisableLocalAuth.Synopsis: Azure Machine Learning compute resources should have local authentication methods disabled.
Azure.ML.DisableLocalAuth.Recommendation: Consider disabling local authentication on ML - Compute as part of a broader security strategy.

Azure.Storage.Naming.Name: Azure.Storage.Naming
Azure.Storage.Naming.DisplayName: Storage Accounts must use standard naming
Azure.Storage.Naming.Synopsis: Storage Accounts without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.Storage.Naming.Recommendation: Consider creating storage accounts with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue.Name: Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue
Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue.DisplayName: Deployment exposes a secret in output
Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue.Synopsis: Outputting a sensitive value from deployment may leak secrets into deployment history or logs.
Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue.Recommendation: Consider removing any deployment output values that return secret values or use secure outputs.

Azure.ML.ComputeIdleShutdown.Name: Azure.ML.ComputeIdleShutdown
Azure.ML.ComputeIdleShutdown.DisplayName: Configure idle shutdown for compute instances
Azure.ML.ComputeIdleShutdown.Synopsis: Configure an idle shutdown timeout for Machine Learning compute instances.
Azure.ML.ComputeIdleShutdown.Recommendation: Consider configuring ML - Compute Instances to automatically shutdown after a period of inactivity to optimize compute costs.

Azure.vWAN.Name.Name: Azure.vWAN.Name
Azure.vWAN.Name.Synopsis: Virtual WAN (vWAN) names should meet naming requirements.
Azure.vWAN.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Virtual WAN (vWAN) naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.VM.UseManagedDisks.Name: Azure.VM.UseManagedDisks
Azure.VM.UseManagedDisks.Synopsis: Virtual machines (VMs) should use managed disks.
Azure.VM.UseManagedDisks.Recommendation: Consider using managed disks for virtual machine (VM) storage.

Azure.AKS.ManagedAAD.Name: Azure.AKS.ManagedAAD
Azure.AKS.ManagedAAD.Synopsis: Use AKS-managed Azure AD to simplify authorization and improve security.
Azure.AKS.ManagedAAD.Recommendation: Consider configuring AKS-managed Azure AD integration for AKS clusters.

Azure.VM.Naming.Name: Azure.VM.Naming
Azure.VM.Naming.DisplayName: Virtual Machine must use standard naming
Azure.VM.Naming.Synopsis: Virtual machines without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.VM.Naming.Recommendation: Consider creating VMs with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.DevBox.ProjectLimit.Name: Azure.DevBox.ProjectLimit
Azure.DevBox.ProjectLimit.DisplayName: Limit number of Dev Boxes per user
Azure.DevBox.ProjectLimit.Synopsis: Limit the number of Dev Boxes a single user can create for a project.
Azure.DevBox.ProjectLimit.Recommendation: Consider limiting the number of Dev Boxes a single user can create for any projects. Additional consider, configuring budgets and alerts to monitor cost exceptions.

Azure.Storage.BlobPublicAccess.Name: Azure.Storage.BlobPublicAccess
Azure.Storage.BlobPublicAccess.DisplayName: Disallow anonymous access to blob service
Azure.Storage.BlobPublicAccess.Synopsis: Storage Accounts should only accept authorized requests.
Azure.Storage.BlobPublicAccess.Recommendation: Consider disallowing anonymous access to storage account blobs unless specifically required. Also consider enforcing this setting using Azure Policy.

Azure.WebPubSub.SLA.Name: Azure.WebPubSub.SLA
Azure.WebPubSub.SLA.DisplayName: Use an SLA for Web PubSub Services
Azure.WebPubSub.SLA.Synopsis: Use SKUs that include an SLA when configuring Web PubSub Services.
Azure.WebPubSub.SLA.Recommendation: Consider using a Standard SKU that includes an SLA.

Azure.VMSS.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.VMSS.AvailabilityZone
Azure.VMSS.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: Deploy virtual machine scale set instances using availability zones
Azure.VMSS.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: Deploy virtual machine scale set instances using availability zones in supported regions to ensure high availability and resilience.
Azure.VMSS.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: Consider configuring VM scale sets to spread instances across at least two (2) availability zones to improve resiliency to issues impacting a zone.

Azure.ML.ComputeVnet.Name: Azure.ML.ComputeVnet
Azure.ML.ComputeVnet.Synopsis: Azure Machine Learning Computes should be hosted in a virtual network (VNet).
Azure.ML.ComputeVnet.Recommendation: Consider using ML - compute hosted in a VNet to provide private connectivity, enhanaced security, and isolation.

Azure.FrontDoorWAF.PreventionMode.Name: Azure.FrontDoorWAF.PreventionMode
Azure.FrontDoorWAF.PreventionMode.DisplayName: Use Front Door WAF policy in prevention mode
Azure.FrontDoorWAF.PreventionMode.Synopsis: Use protection mode in Front Door Web Application Firewall (WAF) policies to protect back end resources.
Azure.FrontDoorWAF.PreventionMode.Recommendation: Consider setting Front Door WAF policy to use protection mode.

Azure.AI.PublicAccess.Name: Azure.AI.PublicAccess
Azure.AI.PublicAccess.Synopsis: Restrict access of Azure AI services to authorized virtual networks.
Azure.AI.PublicAccess.Recommendation: Consider configuring network access restrictions for Azure AI service accounts. Limit access to accounts so that access is permitted from authorized virtual networks only.

Azure.ServiceBus.GeoReplica.Name: Azure.ServiceBus.GeoReplica
Azure.ServiceBus.GeoReplica.Synopsis: Enhance resilience to regional outages by replicating namespaces.
Azure.ServiceBus.GeoReplica.Recommendation: Consider replicating service bus namespaces to improve resiliency to region outages.

Azure.EventGrid.ManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.EventGrid.ManagedIdentity
Azure.EventGrid.ManagedIdentity.DisplayName: Use Managed Identity for Event Grid Topics
Azure.EventGrid.ManagedIdentity.Synopsis: Use managed identities to deliver Event Grid Topic events.
Azure.EventGrid.ManagedIdentity.Recommendation: Consider configuring a managed identity for each Event Grid Topic.

Azure.AKS.ContainerInsights.Name: Azure.AKS.ContainerInsights
Azure.AKS.ContainerInsights.Synopsis: Enable Container insights to monitor AKS cluster workloads.
Azure.AKS.ContainerInsights.Recommendation: Consider enabling Container insights for AKS clusters. Monitoring containers is critical, especially when running production AKS clusters at scale with multiple applications.

Azure.VNG.VPNLegacySKU.Name: Azure.VNG.VPNLegacySKU
Azure.VNG.VPNLegacySKU.DisplayName: Migrate from legacy VPN gateway SKUs
Azure.VNG.VPNLegacySKU.Synopsis: Migrate from legacy SKUs to improve reliability and performance of VPN gateways.
Azure.VNG.VPNLegacySKU.Recommendation: Consider redeploying VPN gateways using new SKUs to improve reliability and performance of gateways.

Azure.ML.UserManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.ML.UserManagedIdentity
Azure.ML.UserManagedIdentity.DisplayName: Azure Machine Learning workspaces should use user-assigned managed identity
Azure.ML.UserManagedIdentity.Synopsis: ML workspaces should use user-assigned managed identity, rather than the default system-assigned managed identity.
Azure.ML.UserManagedIdentity.Recommendation: Consider using a User-Assigned Managed Identity, as part of a broader security and lifecycle management strategy.

Azure.APIM.Name.Name: Azure.APIM.Name
Azure.APIM.Name.DisplayName: Use valid API Management service names
Azure.APIM.Name.Synopsis: API Management service names should meet naming requirements.
Azure.APIM.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet API Management naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure
Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure.Synopsis: Ensure insecure inbound traffic is not permitted to the container app.
Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure.Recommendation: Consider disabling insecure traffic and require all inbound traffic to be over TLS 1.2.

Azure.Template.TemplateSchema.Name: Azure.Template.TemplateSchema
Azure.Template.TemplateSchema.DisplayName: Use a recent template schema version
Azure.Template.TemplateSchema.Synopsis: Use a more recent version of the Azure template schema.
Azure.Template.TemplateSchema.Recommendation: Consider using a more recent schema version for Azure template files.

Azure.AI.Naming.Name: Azure.AI.Naming
Azure.AI.Naming.DisplayName: Azure AI services must use standard naming
Azure.AI.Naming.Synopsis: Azure AI services without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.AI.Naming.Recommendation: Consider creating Azure AI service accounts with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.Storage.MinTLS.Name: Azure.Storage.MinTLS
Azure.Storage.MinTLS.DisplayName: Use secure protocols for Storage Accounts
Azure.Storage.MinTLS.Synopsis: Storage Accounts should not accept weak or deprecated transport protocols for client-server communication.
Azure.Storage.MinTLS.Recommendation: Consider configuring the minimum supported TLS version to be 1.2. Also consider enforcing this setting using Azure Policy.

Azure.LogicApp.LimitHTTPTrigger.Name: Azure.LogicApp.LimitHTTPTrigger
Azure.LogicApp.LimitHTTPTrigger.DisplayName: Logic App HTTP request trigger is not restricted
Azure.LogicApp.LimitHTTPTrigger.Synopsis: Logic Apps using HTTP triggers without restrictions can be accessed from any network location including the Internet.
Azure.LogicApp.LimitHTTPTrigger.Recommendation: Consider restricting HTTP triggers to trusted IP addresses to harden against unauthorized access or exfiltration attempts.

Azure.TrafficManager.Endpoints.Name: Azure.TrafficManager.Endpoints
Azure.TrafficManager.Endpoints.DisplayName: Use at least two Traffic Manager endpoints
Azure.TrafficManager.Endpoints.Synopsis: Traffic Manager should use at lest two enabled endpoints.
Azure.TrafficManager.Endpoints.Recommendation: Consider adding additional endpoints or enabling disabled endpoints. Also consider, using endpoints deployed across different regions to provide high availability.

Azure.AKS.MaintenanceWindow.Name: Azure.AKS.MaintenanceWindow
Azure.AKS.MaintenanceWindow.Synopsis: Configure customer-controlled maintenance windows for AKS clusters.
Azure.AKS.MaintenanceWindow.Recommendation: Consider using a planned maintenance windows for AKS and node OS upgrades to avoid periods of high cluster utilization for improved reliability. Do this by configuring the aksManagedAutoUpgradeSchedule and aksManagedNodeOSUpgradeSchedule maintenance configurations.

Azure.VMSS.ScriptExtensions.Name: Azure.VMSS.ScriptExtensions
Azure.VMSS.ScriptExtensions.DisplayName: Securely pass secrets to Custom Script Extensions for Virtual Machine Scale Sets
Azure.VMSS.ScriptExtensions.Synopsis: Custom Script Extensions scripts that reference secret values must use the protectedSettings.
Azure.VMSS.ScriptExtensions.Recommendation: Consider specifying secure values within  properties.extensionProfile.extensions.protectedSettings to avoid exposing secrets during extension deployments.

Azure.KeyVault.RBAC.Name: Azure.KeyVault.RBAC
Azure.KeyVault.RBAC.Synopsis: Key Vaults should use Azure RBAC as the authorization system for the data plane.
Azure.KeyVault.RBAC.Recommendation: Consider using Azure RBAC as the authorization system on Key Vaults for the data plane.

Azure.AppService.UseHTTPS.Name: Azure.AppService.UseHTTPS
Azure.AppService.UseHTTPS.Synopsis: Unencrypted communication could allow disclosure of information to an untrusted party.
Azure.AppService.UseHTTPS.Recommendation: When access using unencrypted HTTP connection is not required consider enabling HTTPS Only. Also consider using Azure Policy to audit or enforce this configuration.

Azure.Resource.RequiredTags.Name: Azure.Resource.RequiredTags
Azure.Resource.RequiredTags.Synopsis: Resources without a standard tagging convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.Resource.RequiredTags.Recommendation: Consider tagging resources with the tags required by your organization. Additionally consider enforcing required tags at runtime with Azure Policy.

Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity
Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity.Synopsis: Disable session affinity to prevent unbalanced distribution.
Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity.Recommendation: Consider using stateless application design and disabling session affinity to evenly distribute requests across each replica.

Azure.KeyVault.PurgeProtect.Name: Azure.KeyVault.PurgeProtect
Azure.KeyVault.PurgeProtect.Synopsis: Enable Purge Protection on Key Vaults to prevent early purge of vaults and vault items.
Azure.KeyVault.PurgeProtect.Recommendation: Consider enabling purge protection on Key Vaults to enforce retention of vaults and vault items for up to 90 days.

Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors.Name: Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors
Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors.Synopsis: Policy assignments should use a display name and description.
Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors.Recommendation: Consider setting a display name and description for each policy assignment.

Azure.APIM.ProductApproval.Name: Azure.APIM.ProductApproval
Azure.APIM.ProductApproval.Recommendation: Consider configuring all API Management products to require approval.

Azure.SQL.AAD.Name: Azure.SQL.AAD
Azure.SQL.AAD.DisplayName: Use Entra ID authentication with SQL databases
Azure.SQL.AAD.Synopsis: Use Entra ID authentication with Azure SQL databases.
Azure.SQL.AAD.Recommendation: Consider using Entra ID authentication with SQL databases. Additionally, consider disabling SQL authentication.

Azure.Group.RequiredTags.Name: Azure.Group.RequiredTags
Azure.Group.RequiredTags.DisplayName: Resource Groups must use standard tagging
Azure.Group.RequiredTags.Synopsis: Resource groups without a standard tagging convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.Group.RequiredTags.Recommendation: Consider tagging resource groups with the tags required by your organization. Additionally consider enforcing required tags at runtime with Azure Policy.

Azure.APIM.EncryptValues.Name: Azure.APIM.EncryptValues
Azure.APIM.EncryptValues.Synopsis: Encrypt all API Management named values with Key Vault secrets.
Azure.APIM.EncryptValues.Recommendation: Consider encrypting all API Management named values with Key Vault secrets.

Azure.Cosmos.MinTLS.Name: Azure.Cosmos.MinTLS
Azure.Cosmos.MinTLS.DisplayName: Cosmos DB account minimum TLS version
Azure.Cosmos.MinTLS.Synopsis: Cosmos DB accounts should reject TLS versions older than 1.2.
Azure.Cosmos.MinTLS.Recommendation: Consider configuring the minimum supported TLS version to be 1.2. Also consider enforcing this setting using Azure Policy.

Azure.AppConfig.SKU.Name: Azure.AppConfig.SKU
Azure.AppConfig.SKU.Synopsis: App Configuration should use a minimum size of Standard.
Azure.AppConfig.SKU.Recommendation: Consider upgrading App Configuration instances to Standard. Free instances are intended only for early development and testing scenarios.

Azure.VNET.LocalDNS.Name: Azure.VNET.LocalDNS
Azure.VNET.LocalDNS.Synopsis: Virtual networks (VNETs) should use DNS servers deployed within the same Azure region.
Azure.VNET.LocalDNS.Recommendation: Consider deploying redundant DNS services within a connected Azure VNET.

Azure.Group.Name.Name: Azure.Group.Name
Azure.Group.Name.DisplayName: Resource Group name must be valid
Azure.Group.Name.Synopsis: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) has requirements for Resource Groups names.
Azure.Group.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Resource Group naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.APIM.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.APIM.AvailabilityZone
Azure.APIM.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: API management instances should use availability zones in supported regions
Azure.APIM.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: API Management instances should use availability zones in supported regions for high availability.
Azure.APIM.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: Consider using at least two (2) scale units and availability zones to improve resiliency of API Management instances to zone failures.

Azure.LB.Naming.Name: Azure.LB.Naming
Azure.LB.Naming.Synopsis: Load balancer names should use a standard prefix.
Azure.LB.Naming.Recommendation: Consider creating load balancers with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.AppConfig.Name.Name: Azure.AppConfig.Name
Azure.AppConfig.Name.DisplayName: Use valid App Configuration store names
Azure.AppConfig.Name.Synopsis: App Configuration store names should meet naming requirements.
Azure.AppConfig.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet App Configuration store naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.Storage.BlobAccessType.Name: Azure.Storage.BlobAccessType
Azure.Storage.BlobAccessType.Synopsis: Use containers configured with a private access type that requires authorization.
Azure.Storage.BlobAccessType.Recommendation: To provide secure access to data always use the Private access type (default). Also consider, disabling public access for the storage account.

Azure.AppConfig.PurgeProtect.Name: Azure.AppConfig.PurgeProtect
Azure.AppConfig.PurgeProtect.Synopsis: Consider purge protection for app configuration store to ensure store cannot be purged in the retention period.
Azure.AppConfig.PurgeProtect.Recommendation: Consider enabling purge protection for app configuration stores.

Azure.RedisEnterprise.MinTLS.Name: Azure.RedisEnterprise.MinTLS
Azure.RedisEnterprise.MinTLS.Synopsis: Redis Cache should reject TLS versions older than 1.2.
Azure.RedisEnterprise.MinTLS.Recommendation: Consider configuring the minimum supported TLS version to be 1.2. No action is required for new cache deployments, which only support a minimum of TLS 1.2.

Azure.PostgreSQL.ZoneRedundantHA.Name: Azure.PostgreSQL.ZoneRedundantHA
Azure.PostgreSQL.ZoneRedundantHA.Synopsis: Deploy Azure Database for PostgreSQL servers using zone-redundant high availability (HA) in supported regions to ensure high availability and resilience.
Azure.PostgreSQL.ZoneRedundantHA.Recommendation: Consider deploying flexible servers using zone-redundant high-availability to improve the resiliency of your databases.

Azure.VM.PublicIPAttached.Name: Azure.VM.PublicIPAttached
Azure.VM.PublicIPAttached.Synopsis: Avoid attaching public IPs directly to virtual machines.
Azure.VM.PublicIPAttached.Recommendation: Evaluate alternative methods for inbound access to virtual machines to enhance security and minimize risk.

Azure.SQL.FGName.Name: Azure.SQL.FGName
Azure.SQL.FGName.DisplayName: Use valid SQL failover group names
Azure.SQL.FGName.Synopsis: Azure SQL failover group names should meet naming requirements.
Azure.SQL.FGName.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Azure SQL failover group naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.LB.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.LB.AvailabilityZone
Azure.LB.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: Internal load balancers should be zone-redundant
Azure.LB.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: Load balancers deployed with Standard SKU should be zone-redundant for high availability.
Azure.LB.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: Consider using load balancers deployed across at least two availability zones.

Azure.VNET.SubnetName.Name: Azure.VNET.SubnetName
Azure.VNET.SubnetName.DisplayName: Virtual Network Subnet name must be valid
Azure.VNET.SubnetName.Synopsis: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) has requirements for Virtual Network Subnet names.
Azure.VNET.SubnetName.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet subnet naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.Template.LocationDefault.Name: Azure.Template.LocationDefault
Azure.Template.LocationDefault.Synopsis: Set the default value for the location parameter within an ARM template to resource group location.
Azure.Template.LocationDefault.Recommendation: Consider updating the location parameter to use [resourceGroup().location] as the default value.

Azure.KeyVault.Firewall.Name: Azure.KeyVault.Firewall
Azure.KeyVault.Firewall.Synopsis: Key Vault should only accept explicitly allowed traffic.
Azure.KeyVault.Firewall.Recommendation: Consider configuring Key Vault firewall to restrict network access to permitted clients only. Also consider enforcing this setting using Azure Policy.

Azure.Databricks.SecureConnectivity.Name: Azure.Databricks.SecureConnectivity
Azure.Databricks.SecureConnectivity.DisplayName: Enable secure connectivity for Databricks workspaces
Azure.Databricks.SecureConnectivity.Synopsis: Use Databricks workspaces configured for secure cluster connectivity.
Azure.Databricks.SecureConnectivity.Recommendation: Consider configuring Databricks workspaces to use secure cluster connectivity.

Azure.AppGw.MinInstance.Name: Azure.AppGw.MinInstance
Azure.AppGw.MinInstance.DisplayName: Use two or more Application Gateway instances
Azure.AppGw.MinInstance.Synopsis: Application Gateways should use a minimum of two instances.
Azure.AppGw.MinInstance.Recommendation: When using Application Gateway v1 or v2 with auto-scaling disabled, specify the number of instances to be two or more. When auto-scaling is enabled with Application Gateway v2, configure the minimum number of instances to be two or more.

Azure.LB.Name.Name: Azure.LB.Name
Azure.LB.Name.Synopsis: Load Balancer names should meet naming requirements.
Azure.LB.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Load Balancer naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.NIC.Attached.Name: Azure.NIC.Attached
Azure.NIC.Attached.Synopsis: Network interfaces (NICs) that are not used should be removed.
Azure.NIC.Attached.Recommendation: Consider removing network interfaces that are not required to keep deployments lean and focus personnel time on active resources. Also consider using Resource Groups to help manage the lifecycle of related resources together.

Azure.EventGrid.TopicPublicAccess.Name: Azure.EventGrid.TopicPublicAccess
Azure.EventGrid.TopicPublicAccess.Synopsis: Use Private Endpoints to access Event Grid topics and domains.
Azure.EventGrid.TopicPublicAccess.Recommendation: Consider using Private Endpoints to access Event Grid topics and domains. To limit access to Event Grid topics and domains, disable public access.

Azure.AKS.AuditAdmin.Name: Azure.AKS.AuditAdmin
Azure.AKS.AuditAdmin.Synopsis: Use kube-audit-admin instead of kube-audit to capture administrative actions in AKS clusters.
Azure.AKS.AuditAdmin.Recommendation: Consider using kube-audit-admin logging instead of kube-audit when detailed logging of every API request is not required. This approach helps in managing log volume and associated costs while still capturing essential administrative actions.

Azure.FrontDoorWAF.Enabled.Name: Azure.FrontDoorWAF.Enabled
Azure.FrontDoorWAF.Enabled.Synopsis: Front Door Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy must be enabled to protect back end resources.

Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef.Name: Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef
Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef.Synopsis: Use a valid secret reference within parameter files.
Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef.Recommendation: Check the secret value Key Vault reference is valid.

Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.Name: Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade
Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.DisplayName: Kubernetes Cluster version is not automatically upgraded
Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.Synopsis: New versions of Kubernetes are released regularly. Upgrading each release manually can add operational overhead without realizing equivalent value.
Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.Recommendation: Consider enabling auto-upgrades for AKS clusters by setting an auto-upgrade channel.

Azure.ASE.MigrateV3.Name: Azure.ASE.MigrateV3
Azure.ASE.MigrateV3.DisplayName: Migrate to App Service Environment v3
Azure.ASE.MigrateV3.Synopsis: Use ASEv3 as replacement for the classic app service environment versions ASEv1 and ASEv2.
Azure.ASE.MigrateV3.Recommendation: Classic App Service Environments should migrate to App Service Environment v3.

Azure.VM.Agent.Name: Azure.VM.Agent
Azure.VM.Agent.DisplayName: Virtual Machine agent is not provisioned
Azure.VM.Agent.Synopsis: Virtual Machines (VMs) without an agent provisioned are unable to use monitoring, management, and security extensions.
Azure.VM.Agent.Recommendation: Consider automatically provisioning the VM agent for all supported operating systems to reduce management overhead of VMs.

Azure.EventHub.Usage.Name: Azure.EventHub.Usage
Azure.EventHub.Usage.Synopsis: Regularly remove unused resources to reduce costs.
Azure.EventHub.Usage.Recommendation: Consider removing Event Hub namespaces that are not used.

Azure.SQL.AllowAzureAccess.Name: Azure.SQL.AllowAzureAccess
Azure.SQL.AllowAzureAccess.DisplayName: Limit SQL database network access to trusted IP addresses
Azure.SQL.AllowAzureAccess.Synopsis: Determine if access from Azure services is required.
Azure.SQL.AllowAzureAccess.Recommendation: Consider using a stable IP address or configure virtual network based firewall rules. Determine if access from Azure services is required for the services connecting to the hosted databases.

Azure.SQL.TDE.Name: Azure.SQL.TDE
Azure.SQL.TDE.Synopsis: Use Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) with Azure SQL Database.
Azure.SQL.TDE.Recommendation: Consider enabling Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) for Azure SQL Databases to perform encryption at rest.

Azure.AppService.MinPlan.Name: Azure.AppService.MinPlan
Azure.AppService.MinPlan.Synopsis: Use at least a Standard App Service Plan.
Azure.AppService.MinPlan.Recommendation: Consider using a standard or premium plan for hosting apps on Azure App Service.

Azure.Defender.Dns.Name: Azure.Defender.Dns
Azure.Defender.Dns.DisplayName: Set Microsoft Defender for DNS to the Standard tier
Azure.Defender.Dns.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for DNS to provide additional protection to virtual network and resources.

Azure.KeyVault.AccessPolicy.Name: Azure.KeyVault.AccessPolicy
Azure.KeyVault.AccessPolicy.DisplayName: Limit access to Key Vault data
Azure.KeyVault.AccessPolicy.Synopsis: Use the principal of least privilege when assigning access to Key Vault.
Azure.KeyVault.AccessPolicy.Recommendation: Consider assigning access to Key Vault data based on the principle of least privilege.

Azure.APIM.MultiRegionGateway.Name: Azure.APIM.MultiRegionGateway
Azure.APIM.MultiRegionGateway.Synopsis: API Management instances should have multi-region deployment gateways enabled.
Azure.APIM.MultiRegionGateway.Recommendation: Consider enabling each regional API gateway location for multi-region redundancy.

Azure.AKS.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.AKS.AvailabilityZone
Azure.AKS.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: AKS clusters should use Availability zones in supported regions
Azure.AKS.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: AKS clusters deployed with virtual machine scale sets should use availability zones in supported regions for high availability.
Azure.AKS.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: Consider using availability zones for AKS clusters deployed with virtual machine scale sets.

Azure.SQLMI.AAD.Name: Azure.SQLMI.AAD
Azure.SQLMI.AAD.DisplayName: Use AAD authentication with SQL Managed Instance
Azure.SQLMI.AAD.Synopsis: Use Azure Active Directory (AAD) authentication with Azure SQL Managed Instance.
Azure.SQLMI.AAD.Recommendation: Consider using Azure Active Directory (AAD) authentication with SQL Managed Instance. Additionally, consider disabling SQL authentication.

Azure.SignalR.ManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.SignalR.ManagedIdentity
Azure.SignalR.ManagedIdentity.DisplayName: Use managed identities for SignalR Services
Azure.SignalR.ManagedIdentity.Synopsis: Configure SignalR Services to use managed identities to access Azure resources securely.
Azure.SignalR.ManagedIdentity.Recommendation: Consider configuring a managed identity for each SignalR Service. Also consider using managed identities to authenticate to related Azure services.

Azure.Cosmos.DisableMetadataWrite.Name: Azure.Cosmos.DisableMetadataWrite
Azure.Cosmos.DisableMetadataWrite.DisplayName: Restrict user access to data operations in Azure Cosmos DB
Azure.Cosmos.DisableMetadataWrite.Synopsis: Use Entra ID identities for management place operations in Azure Cosmos DB.
Azure.Cosmos.DisableMetadataWrite.Recommendation: Consider limiting key and resource tokens to data plane operations only. Use Microsoft Entra ID identities for authorizing account and resource management operations.

Azure.APIM.ProductDescriptors.Name: Azure.APIM.ProductDescriptors
Azure.APIM.ProductDescriptors.Synopsis: API Management products should have a display name and description.
Azure.APIM.ProductDescriptors.Recommendation: Consider using display name and description fields on products to convey intended purpose and usage. Display name and description fields should be human readable and easy to understand.

Azure.AppService.ARRAffinity.Name: Azure.AppService.ARRAffinity
Azure.AppService.ARRAffinity.Synopsis: Disable client affinity for stateless services.
Azure.AppService.ARRAffinity.Recommendation: Azure App Service sites make use of Application Request Routing (ARR) by default. Consider disabling ARR affinity for stateless applications.

Azure.AppGw.MinSku.Name: Azure.AppGw.MinSku
Azure.AppGw.MinSku.Synopsis: Application Gateway should use a minimum instance size of Medium.
Azure.AppGw.MinSku.Recommendation: Application Gateways using v1 SKUs should be deployed with an instance size of Medium or Large. Small instance sizes are intended for development and testing scenarios.

Azure.RBAC.LimitMGDelegation.Name: Azure.RBAC.LimitMGDelegation

Consider limiting the number of assignment inherited from Management Groups by scoping permission to individual Resource Group.
Azure Blueprints can be used to rollout standard RBAC assignments to common resources. Additionally RBAC assignments can be deployed using Azure Resource Manager templates.

Azure.Template.ParameterMinMaxValue.Name: Azure.Template.ParameterMinMaxValue
Azure.Template.ParameterMinMaxValue.DisplayName: Use minValue and maxValue with correct type
Azure.Template.ParameterMinMaxValue.Synopsis: Template parameters minValue and maxValue constraints must be valid.
Azure.Template.ParameterMinMaxValue.Recommendation: Consider updating parameter definitions using minValue or maxValue. When using minValue or maxValue these values must be integers and only apply to int parameters.

Azure.Deployment.AdminUsername.Name: Azure.Deployment.AdminUsername
Azure.Deployment.AdminUsername.Synopsis: A sensitive property set from deterministic or hardcoded values is not secure.
Azure.Deployment.AdminUsername.Recommendation: Sensitive properties should be passed as parameters. Avoid using deterministic or hardcoded values for sensitive properties.

Azure.MySQL.DefenderCloud.Name: Azure.MySQL.DefenderCloud
Azure.MySQL.DefenderCloud.Synopsis: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for Azure Database for MySQL.
Azure.MySQL.DefenderCloud.Recommendation: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for Azure Database for MySQL.

Azure.EventGrid.DomainNaming.Name: Azure.EventGrid.DomainNaming
Azure.EventGrid.DomainNaming.DisplayName: Event Grid Domains must use standard naming
Azure.EventGrid.DomainNaming.Synopsis: Event Grid domains without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.EventGrid.DomainNaming.Recommendation: Consider creating Event Grid domains with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.Template.ParameterValue.Name: Azure.Template.ParameterValue
Azure.Template.ParameterValue.DisplayName: Specify a value for each parameter
Azure.Template.ParameterValue.Synopsis: Specify a value for each parameter in template parameter files.
Azure.Template.ParameterValue.Recommendation: Consider defining a value for each parameter in the template parameter file.

Azure.AVD.ScheduleAgentUpdate.Name: Azure.AVD.ScheduleAgentUpdate

Azure.AVD.ScheduleAgentUpdate.Synopsis: Define a windows for agent updates to minimize disruptions to users.
Azure.AVD.ScheduleAgentUpdate.Recommendation: Consider defining a maintenance window for agent updates to minimize disruptions to users on AVD host pools.

Azure.PostgreSQL.DefenderCloud.Synopsis: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for Azure Database for PostgreSQL.
Azure.PostgreSQL.DefenderCloud.Recommendation: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

Also consider using Resource Groups to help manage the lifecycle of related resources together. Apply tags to all resources to help identify resources that are attached to specific workloads.

Azure.APIM.DefenderCloud.Recommendation: Consider onboarding APIs published in Azure API Management to Microsoft Defender for APIs.

Azure.ACR.MinSku.Name: Azure.ACR.MinSku
Azure.ACR.MinSku.Synopsis: ACR should use the Premium or Standard SKU for production deployments.
Azure.ACR.MinSku.Recommendation: Consider using the Premium Container Registry SKU for production deployments.

Azure.ContainerApp.Name.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.Name

Azure.Defender.Containers.Name: Azure.Defender.Containers

Azure.Defender.Containers.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for Containers to protect your container-based workloads.

Azure.FrontDoor.ProbeMethod.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.ProbeMethod

Azure.FrontDoor.ProbeMethod.Recommendation: Consider configuring health probes to query backend health endpoints using HEAD requests to reduce performance overhead.

Azure.AppService.HTTP2.Name: Azure.AppService.HTTP2

Azure.NSG.DenyAllInbound.Name: Azure.NSG.DenyAllInbound

Azure.NSG.DenyAllInbound.Recommendation: Consider using a higher priority number for deny all rules to allow permitted traffic rules to be added and processed first. Consider enabling Flow Logs on all critical subnets in your subscription as an auditability and security best practice.

Azure.CDN.UseFrontDoor.Name: Azure.CDN.UseFrontDoor

Azure.AKS.PoolScaleSet.Recommendation:
Multiple node pools and the cluster autoscaler can be used to improve the scalability and performance of a cluster while minimizing cost.
Using VM scale sets is a deployment time configuration. Consider redeploying the AKS cluster with VM Scale Sets instead of Availability Sets.

Azure.AppService.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.AppService.AvailabilityZone
Azure.AppService.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: Deploy app service plan instances using availability zones
Azure.AppService.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: Deploy app service plan instances using availability zones in supported regions to ensure high availability and resilience.
Azure.AppService.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: Consider using enabling zone redundancy using availability zones to improve the resiliency of your solution.

Azure.EventHub.MinTLS.Name: Azure.EventHub.MinTLS

Azure.FrontDoor.State.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.State

Azure.ImageBuilder.ValidateHash.Name: Azure.ImageBuilder.ValidateHash

Azure.ServiceBus.AuditLogs.Name: Azure.ServiceBus.AuditLogs

Azure.ServiceBus.AuditLogs.Recommendation: Consider configuring diagnostic settings to record interactions with data of the Service Bus.

Azure.MySQL.AADOnly.Name: Azure.MySQL.AADOnly

Azure.RedisEnterprise.Zones.Name: Azure.RedisEnterprise.Zones

Azure.RedisEnterprise.Zones.Recommendation: Consider using availability zones for Enterprise Redis Cache deployed in supported regions.

Azure.MySQL.FirewallRuleCount.Recommendation: The MySQL server has greater then ten (10) firewall rules. Some rules may not be needed.

Azure.ContainerApp.ManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.ManagedIdentity

Azure.AppService.ManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.AppService.ManagedIdentity

Azure.PostgreSQL.MaintenanceWindow.Name: Azure.PostgreSQL.MaintenanceWindow

Azure.PostgreSQL.MaintenanceWindow.Recommendation: Consider using a customer-controlled maintenance window to efficiently schedule updates and minimize disruptions.

Azure.EventGrid.DomainTLS.Name: Azure.EventGrid.DomainTLS
Azure.EventGrid.DomainTLS.DisplayName: Event Grid Domain accepts insecure TLS versions
Azure.EventGrid.DomainTLS.Synopsis: Weak or deprecated transport protocols for client-server communication introduce security vulnerabilities.
Azure.EventGrid.DomainTLS.Recommendation: Configure the minimum supported TLS version to be 1.2. Also consider enforcing this setting using Azure Policy.

Azure.AKS.EphemeralOSDisk.Name: Azure.AKS.EphemeralOSDisk
Azure.AKS.EphemeralOSDisk.Synopsis: AKS clusters should use ephemeral OS disks which can provide lower read/write latency, along with faster node scaling and cluster upgrades.
Azure.AKS.EphemeralOSDisk.Recommendation: AKS clusters should use ephemeral OS disks.

Azure.ACR.SoftDelete.Name: Azure.ACR.SoftDelete
Azure.ACR.SoftDelete.Synopsis: Azure Container Registries should have soft delete policy enabled.
Azure.ACR.SoftDelete.Recommendation: Azure Container Registries should have soft delete enabled to enable recovery of accidentally deleted artifacts.

Azure.VM.ASAlignment.Name: Azure.VM.ASAlignment
Azure.VM.ASAlignment.Synopsis: Use availability sets aligned with managed disks fault domains.
Azure.VM.ASAlignment.Recommendation: Consider deploying VMs with managed disks into aligned availability sets.

Azure.FrontDoor.ManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.ManagedIdentity
Azure.FrontDoor.ManagedIdentity.Synopsis: Ensure Front Door uses a managed identity to authorize access to Azure resources.
Azure.FrontDoor.ManagedIdentity.Recommendation: Consider configure a managed identity to allow support for Azure AD authentication.

Azure.VM.DiskSizeAlignment.Name: Azure.VM.DiskSizeAlignment
Azure.VM.DiskSizeAlignment.DisplayName: Allocate VM disks aligned to billing model
Azure.VM.DiskSizeAlignment.Synopsis: Align to the Managed Disk billing increments to improve cost efficiency.
Azure.VM.DiskSizeAlignment.Recommendation: Consider aligning provisioned disk sizes to the billing increments for Managed Disks to improve cost efficiency.

Azure.Template.Resources.Name: Azure.Template.Resources
Azure.Template.Resources.Synopsis: Each Azure Resource Manager (ARM) template file should deploy at least one resource.
Azure.Template.Resources.Recommendation: Consider removing Azure template files that do not deploy any resources.

Azure.Cosmos.ContinuousBackup.Name: Azure.Cosmos.ContinuousBackup
Azure.Cosmos.ContinuousBackup.Synopsis: Enable continuous backup on Cosmos DB accounts.
Azure.Cosmos.ContinuousBackup.Recommendation: Consider configuring Azure Cosmos DB with continuous backup mode for enhanced data protection (RTO & RPO) and easier recovery.

Azure.Search.Naming.Name: Azure.Search.Naming
Azure.Search.Naming.DisplayName: AI Search services must use standard naming
Azure.Search.Naming.Synopsis: Azure AI Search services without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.Search.Naming.Recommendation: Consider creating AI Search service instances with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.Name: Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange
Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.DisplayName: Review Azure MariaDB server firewall permitted public IP addresses
Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.Synopsis: Determine if there is an excessive number of permitted IP addresses.
Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.Recommendation: Review the number of Azure for MariaDB server firewall permitted public IP addresses configured. Consider to removing IP addresses that are no longer needed.

Azure.VM.Name.Name: Azure.VM.Name
Azure.VM.Name.Synopsis: Virtual Machine (VM) names should meet naming requirements.
Azure.VM.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet VM resource name requirements. Additionally, consider using a resource name that meeting OS naming requirements.

Azure.VM.MaintenanceConfig.Name: Azure.VM.MaintenanceConfig
Azure.VM.MaintenanceConfig.Synopsis: Use a maintenance configuration for virtual machines.
Azure.VM.MaintenanceConfig.Recommendation: Consider associating a maintenance configuration to your VM to reduce unplanned disruptions to your workloads.

Azure.KeyVault.Logs.Name: Azure.KeyVault.Logs
Azure.KeyVault.Logs.Synopsis: Ensure audit diagnostics logs are enabled to audit Key Vault access.
Azure.KeyVault.Logs.Recommendation: Configure audit diagnostics logs to audit Key Vault access.

Azure.FrontDoor.UseCaching.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.UseCaching
Azure.FrontDoor.UseCaching.Synopsis: Use caching to reduce retrieving contents from origins.
Azure.FrontDoor.UseCaching.Recommendation: Use caching to reduce retrieving contents from origins and improve overall performance.

Azure.Storage.ContainerSoftDelete.Name: Azure.Storage.ContainerSoftDelete
Azure.Storage.ContainerSoftDelete.Synopsis: Enable container soft delete on Storage Accounts.
Azure.Storage.ContainerSoftDelete.Recommendation: Consider enabling container soft delete on storage accounts to protect blob containers from accidental deletion or modification.

Azure.AppConfig.DisableLocalAuth.Name: Azure.AppConfig.DisableLocalAuth
Azure.AppConfig.DisableLocalAuth.DisplayName: App Configuration access keys are enabled
Azure.AppConfig.DisableLocalAuth.Synopsis: Access keys allow depersonalized access to App Configuration using a shared secret.
Azure.AppConfig.DisableLocalAuth.Recommendation: Consider only using Entra ID identities to access App Configuration data. Then disable authentication based on access keys or SAS tokens.

Azure.Search.IndexSLA.Name: Azure.Search.IndexSLA
Azure.Search.IndexSLA.DisplayName: Search index update SLA minimum replicas
Azure.Search.IndexSLA.Synopsis: Use a minimum of 3 replicas to receive an SLA for query and index updates.
Azure.Search.IndexSLA.Recommendation: Consider increasing the number of replicas to a minimum of 3 to receive an SLA on index update requests.

Azure.Template.ParameterDataTypes.Name: Azure.Template.ParameterDataTypes
Azure.Template.ParameterDataTypes.Synopsis: Set the parameter default value to a value of the same type.
Azure.Template.ParameterDataTypes.Recommendation: Consider updating the parameter default value to a value of the same type.

Azure.Deployment.Name.Name: Azure.Deployment.Name
Azure.Deployment.Name.Synopsis: Nested deployments should meet naming requirements of deployments.
Azure.Deployment.Name.Recommendation: Consider using nested deployment names thas meets naming requirements of deployments. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.AppGwWAF.PreventionMode.Name: Azure.AppGwWAF.PreventionMode
Azure.AppGwWAF.PreventionMode.DisplayName: Use Application Gateway WAF policy in prevention mode
Azure.AppGwWAF.PreventionMode.Synopsis: Use protection mode in Application Gateway Web Application Firewall (WAF) policies to protect back end resources.
Azure.AppGwWAF.PreventionMode.Recommendation: Consider setting Application Gateway WAF policy to use protection mode.

Azure.EventHub.Firewall.Name: Azure.EventHub.Firewall
Azure.EventHub.Firewall.DisplayName: Access to the namespace endpoints should be restricted to only allowed sources
Azure.EventHub.Firewall.Synopsis: Access to the namespace endpoints should be restricted to only allowed sources.
Azure.EventHub.Firewall.Recommendation: Consider restricting network access to the Event Hub namespace by requiring private endpoints or by limiting access to permitted client addresses with the service firewall.

Azure.Firewall.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.Firewall.AvailabilityZone
Azure.Firewall.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: Deploy firewall instances using availability zones
Azure.Firewall.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: Deploy firewall instances using availability zones in supported regions to ensure high availability and resilience.
Azure.Firewall.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: To improve the resiliency of firewall instances against zone failures, it is recommended to use at least two (2) availability zones. This configuration enhances fault tolerance and ensures continued operation even if one zone experiences an outage.

Azure.PostgreSQL.AADOnly.Name: Azure.PostgreSQL.AADOnly
Azure.PostgreSQL.AADOnly.DisplayName: Entra ID only authentication with PostgreSQL databases
Azure.PostgreSQL.AADOnly.Synopsis: Ensure Entra ID only authentication is enabled with Azure Database for PostgreSQL databases.
Azure.PostgreSQL.AADOnly.Recommendation: Consider using Entra ID only authentication. Also consider using Azure Policy for Entra ID only authentication with Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

Azure.Storage.Defender.DataScan.Name: Azure.Storage.Defender.DataScan
Azure.Storage.Defender.DataScan.Synopsis: Enable sensitive data threat detection in Microsoft Defender for Storage.
Azure.Storage.Defender.DataScan.Recommendation: Consider enabling sensitive data threat detection using Microsoft Defender for Storage on the Storage Account. Additionally, consider enabling sensitive data threat detection for all Storage Accounts within a subscription.

Azure.VM.Standalone.Name: Azure.VM.Standalone
Azure.VM.Standalone.DisplayName: Virtual Machine is not configured for improved SLA
Azure.VM.Standalone.Synopsis: Single instance VMs are a single point of failure, however reliability can be improved by using premium storage.
Azure.VM.Standalone.Recommendation: Consider using availability zones/ sets or only premium/ ultra disks to improve SLA.

Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.Name: Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs
Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.DisplayName: AKS clusters should collect platform diagnostic logs
Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.Synopsis: AKS clusters should collect platform diagnostic logs to monitor the state of workloads.
Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.Recommendation: Consider configuring diagnostic settings to capture platform logs from AKS clusters.

Azure.VM.MultiTenantHosting.Name: Azure.VM.MultiTenantHosting
Azure.VM.MultiTenantHosting.Synopsis: Deploy Windows 10 and 11 virtual machines in Azure using Multi-tenant Hosting Rights to leverage your existing Windows licenses.
Azure.VM.MultiTenantHosting.Recommendation: Consider using Multi-tenant Hosting Rights to maximize your existing licensing investments when deploying Windows VMs in Azure.

Azure.Defender.AppServices.Name: Azure.Defender.AppServices
Azure.Defender.AppServices.DisplayName: Configure Microsoft Defender for App Services to the Standard tier
Azure.Defender.AppServices.Synopsis: Enable Microsoft Defender for App Service.
Azure.Defender.AppServices.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for App Service to protect your web apps and APIs.

Azure.Storage.Name.Name: Azure.Storage.Name
Azure.Storage.Name.DisplayName: Storage Account name must be valid
Azure.Storage.Name.Synopsis: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) has requirements for Storage Account names.
Azure.Storage.Name.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Storage Account naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.ASE.AvailabilityZone.Name: Azure.ASE.AvailabilityZone
Azure.ASE.AvailabilityZone.DisplayName: Deploy app service environments using availability zones
Azure.ASE.AvailabilityZone.Synopsis: Deploy app service environments using availability zones in supported regions to ensure high availability and resilience.
Azure.ASE.AvailabilityZone.Recommendation: Consider using enabling zone redundancy using availability zones to improve the resiliency of your solution.

Azure.Defender.Storage.Name: Azure.Defender.Storage
Azure.Defender.Storage.DisplayName: Configure Microsoft Defender for Storage to the Standard tier
Azure.Defender.Storage.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for Storage to protect your data hosted in storage accounts.

Azure.AKS.LocalAccounts.Name: Azure.AKS.LocalAccounts
Azure.AKS.LocalAccounts.Synopsis: Enforce named user accounts with RBAC assigned permissions.
Azure.AKS.LocalAccounts.Recommendation: Consider enforcing usage of named accounts by disabling local Kubernetes account credentials. Also consider enforcing this setting using Azure Policy.

Azure.VNET.SubnetNaming.Name: Azure.VNET.SubnetNaming
Azure.VNET.SubnetNaming.DisplayName: Virtual Network Subnet must use standard naming
Azure.VNET.SubnetNaming.Synopsis: Virtual Network subnets without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.VNET.SubnetNaming.Recommendation: Consider creating subnets with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU.Name: Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU
Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU.DisplayName: Public IP address uses basic SKU
Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU.Synopsis: The basic SKU is being retired on 30 September 2025, and does not include several reliability and security features.
Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU.Recommendation: Consider using Standard SKU for Public IP addresses deployed in production.

Azure.Defender.SecurityContact.Name: Azure.Defender.SecurityContact
Azure.Defender.SecurityContact.DisplayName: Defender for Cloud notification contact not set
Azure.Defender.SecurityContact.Synopsis: Important security notifications may be lost or not processed in a timely manner when a clear security contact is not identified.
Azure.Defender.SecurityContact.Recommendation: Consider configuring a security notification email address to assist timely notification and incident response.

Azure.Resource.UseTags.Name: Azure.Resource.UseTags
Azure.Resource.UseTags.Synopsis: Azure resources should be tagged using a standard convention.
Azure.Resource.UseTags.Recommendation:
Consider tagging resources using a standard convention. Identify mandatory and optional tags then tag all resources and resource groups using this standard.
Also consider using Azure Policy to enforce mandatory tags.

Azure.AppService.WebSecureFtp.Name: Azure.AppService.WebSecureFtp
Azure.AppService.WebSecureFtp.Synopsis: Web apps should disable insecure FTP and configure SFTP when required.
Azure.AppService.WebSecureFtp.Recommendation: Consider disabling insecure FTP and configure SFTP only when required. Also consider using Azure Policy to audit or enforce this configuration.

Azure.MySQL.UseFlexible.Name: Azure.MySQL.UseFlexible
Azure.MySQL.UseFlexible.DisplayName: Use Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server
Azure.MySQL.UseFlexible.Synopsis: Use Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server deployment model.
Azure.MySQL.UseFlexible.Recommendation: Consider migrating to Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server deployment model.

Azure.VNG.ERLegacySKU.Name: Azure.VNG.ERLegacySKU
Azure.VNG.ERLegacySKU.DisplayName: Migrate from legacy ER gateway SKUs
Azure.VNG.ERLegacySKU.Synopsis: Migrate from legacy SKUs to improve reliability and performance of ExpressRoute (ER) gateways.
Azure.VNG.ERLegacySKU.Recommendation: Consider redeploying ER gateways using new SKUs to improve reliability and performance of gateways.

Azure.Defender.Arm.Name: Azure.Defender.Arm
Azure.Defender.Arm.DisplayName: Set Microsoft Defender for ARM to the Standard tier
Azure.Defender.Arm.Synopsis: Enable Microsoft Defender for Azure Resource Manager (ARM).
Azure.Defender.Arm.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for Resource Manager to provide additional protection to control plane activities.

Azure.EntraDS.SKU.Name: Azure.EntraDS.SKU
Azure.EntraDS.SKU.DisplayName: Entra Domain Services uses minimum SKU
Azure.EntraDS.SKU.Synopsis: The default SKU for Microsoft Entra Domain Services supports resiliency in a single region.
Azure.EntraDS.SKU.Recommendation: Consider using a minimum Enterprise SKU to support resiliency across multiple regions.

Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.Name: Azure.ACR.ContainerScan
Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.DisplayName: Container Registry images are not scanned regularly for vulnerabilities
Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.Synopsis: Container images or their base images may have vulnerabilities discovered after they are built.
Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for Cloud to scan for security vulnerabilities in container images.

Azure.APIM.MultiRegion.Name: Azure.APIM.MultiRegion
Azure.APIM.MultiRegion.DisplayName: API Management instances should use multi-region deployment
Azure.APIM.MultiRegion.Synopsis: Enhance service availability and resilience by deploying API Management instances across multiple regions.
Azure.APIM.MultiRegion.Recommendation: Consider deploying API Management instances across multiple regions to enhance service availability and resilience.

Azure.Template.UseLocationParameter.Name: Azure.Template.UseLocationParameter
Azure.Template.UseLocationParameter.DisplayName: Use a location parameter to specify resource location
Azure.Template.UseLocationParameter.Synopsis: Template should reference a location parameter to specify resource location.
Azure.Template.UseLocationParameter.Recommendation: Consider using parameters('location) instead of resourceGroup().location. Using a location parameter enabled users of the template to specify the location of deployed resources.

Azure.EventGrid.SystemTopicNaming.Name: Azure.EventGrid.SystemTopicNaming
Azure.EventGrid.SystemTopicNaming.DisplayName: Event Grid System Topics must use standard naming
Azure.EventGrid.SystemTopicNaming.Synopsis: Event Grid system topics without a standard naming convention may be difficult to identify and manage.
Azure.EventGrid.SystemTopicNaming.Recommendation: Consider creating Event Grid system topics with a standard name. Additionally consider using Azure Policy to only permit creation using a standard naming convention.

Azure.ImageBuilder.CustomizeHash.Name: Azure.ImageBuilder.CustomizeHash
Azure.ImageBuilder.CustomizeHash.DisplayName: Image Builder customization script is not pinned
Azure.ImageBuilder.CustomizeHash.Synopsis: External scripts that are not pinned may be modified to execute privileged actions by an unauthorized user.
Azure.ImageBuilder.CustomizeHash.Recommendation: Consider reviewing all scripts and using a hash to ensure customization scripts have not been modified since they were last reviewed.
